alert.note: Alert for Central Oahu; Ewa Plain; Honolulu Metro; Koolau Leeward; Koolau Windward; Olomana (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 1:15AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Honolulu through 215 AM HST... At 114 AM HST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Salt Lake, or near Honolulu, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Honolulu, Kaneohe Marine Base, Kahaluu, Ahuimanu, Salt Lake, Manoa, Maunawili, Kaneohe, Waikane, Kalihi, Waiahole, Moanalua, Aiea, Pearl City, Halawa, Kailua, Iroquois Point, Ewa Beach, Kaaawa and Punaluu. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Oahu; Ewa Plain; Honolulu Metro; Koolau Leeward; Koolau Windward; Olomana
